description: Represented as a child. The figure is in the tribhanga stance and carries a cymbal in his left hand. The right hand is in a gesturing position. Patina brownish-green. Index finger of right hand missing.
text: The child-saint, Sambandar, lived in South India during the seventh century. He became very popular during the ensuing Chola and Vajayana periods and his hymns were included in the liturgy of many temples dedicated to Shiva. The saint is typically depicted as a nude child either standing gracefully, as shown here, or performing a dance. The holes in the base indicate that this image was carried in religious processions.
title: Sambandar
